purpose: Summarize consumer perceptions and behaviors related to lockdown, car buying, and mobility.
narrative_role: Provide a high-level overview of key findings from the survey.
title: Executive summary
supporting_facts: Overall second lockdown in EU is perceived as less challenging and disruptive than first one in spring.
Higher income respondents feel less affected from second (partial) lock-down.
Intent to buy a new car has dropped, especially in France.
Used car purchase intent more robust.
58% of EU consumers travelling less, showing a 7 p.p. decrease vs. September.
reasoning_strategy: Provide insights based on survey data to highlight changes in consumer behavior.
data_points: 13pp drop in new car purchase intent
-19 p.p. in France for new car purchase
-8pp in IT for used car purchase
